  this module, such as f377c0229c006b02f43a14be4979553e983cb98e.
- Ability to set project-based access control for images

Additional reasoning for this change is in the blueprint.

Important note: this change does not work on Ubuntu under Juno due to a
major bug in the version of python-openstackclient shipped in UCA [1].
This change targets the Kilo releases.

Note about how this relates to the Keystone v3 work: glance does not
yet have the ability to associate images with domains. It does have the
ability to associate images with projects, but currently this module
does not take advantage of that. Instead all images belong to whatever
project the glance user authenticates with (which implies that, in
order to be useful, images created with the glance provider must be
public, otherwise they will be hidden from users). This change provides
the ability potentially add access control for images, since it will
now be possible to authenticate as different users. In any case, the
glance_image puppet resource currently requires that users create
images with unique names, even though glance has no such restriction,
regardless of project association. We therefore do not need to worry
about how to uniquely identify glance images if domain awareness is
added to glance, because we will simply continue to enforce unique
names.

Note about performance: the self.instances and instances methods make
API requests for each image found in the list of instances. This is not
a change from how this was implemented before. The --long formatted
list, either from the glance client or openstackclient, does not
provide all information needed to query an instance and populate
setters. Future patches could possibly improve on this.

Other details of this change:

- Removes auth_glance method, replaced by the request and
  glance_request methods
- Removes auth_glance_stdin method which was not being used
- Removes parse_table which is now unnecessary because openstackclient
  formats its responses as CSV and Puppet::Provider::Openstack#request
  returns the results a hash
- Removes remove_warnings methods which are handled by
  Puppet::Provider::Openstack#request
- Removes list_glance_images and get_glance_image_attr which are
  sufficiently replaced by using the 'list' and 'show' commands with
  Puppet::Provider::Openstack's request method.
- Removed self.prefetch since we can't populate auth parameters during
  a prefetch. Instead we prepopulate the list via the instances method.
- Added a flush method to do updates more efficiently
- Changed is_public property to accept true/false in addition to yes/no
  and to munge to a symbol instead of a capitalized string, for
  consistency with keystone_tenant's enabled property
- Move the reset method into the spec tests since it is only necessary
  for testing
- Added tests for glance_image, which did not exist before
- Removed connection retry test since this is taken care of in
  openstacklib

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-openstackclient/+bug/1269821

  a prefetch. Instead we prepopulate the list via the instances method.
- Added a flush method to do updates more efficiently
- Changed is_public property to accept true/false in addition to yes/no
  and to munge to a symbol instead of a capitalized string, for
  consistency with keystone_tenant's enabled property
- Move the reset method into the spec tests since it is only necessary
  for testing
- Added tests for glance_image, which did not exist before
- Removed connection retry test since this is taken care of in
  openstacklib

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-openstackclient/+bug/1269821

commit_message:
Use OpenstackClient for glance_image auth

This patch changes the glance_image provider to use
puppet-openstacklib's authentication methods, which use
python-openstackclient as an interface, instead of the glance command
line client. The benefits of this is:

- Code reduction. This patch reduces the amount of code in the
  glance parent provider and glance_image provider by reusing code from
  Puppet::Provider::Openstack instead of implementing authentication,
  retries, and response parsing in the provider.
- Presumed reduction in sudden API changes that require quick fixes in
  this module, such as f377c0229c006b02f43a14be4979553e983cb98e.
- Ability to set project-based access control for images

Additional reasoning for this change is in the blueprint.

Important note: this change does not work on Ubuntu under Juno due to a
major bug in the version of python-openstackclient shipped in UCA [1].
This change targets the Kilo releases.

Note about performance: the self.instances and instances methods make
API requests for each image found in the list of instances. This is not
a change from how this was implemented before. The --long formatted
list, either from the glance client or openstackclient, does not
provide all information needed to query an instance and populate
setters. Future patches could possibly improve on this.

Other details of this change:

- Removes auth_glance method, replaced by the request and
  glance_request methods
- Removes auth_glance_stdin method which was not being used
- Removes parse_table which is now unnecessary because openstackclient
  formats its responses as CSV and Puppet::Provider::Openstack#request
  returns the results a hash
- Removes remove_warnings methods which are handled by
  Puppet::Provider::Openstack#request
- Removes list_glance_images and get_glance_image_attr which are
  sufficiently replaced by using the 'list' and 'show' commands with
  Puppet::Provider::Openstack's request method.
- Removed self.prefetch since we can't populate auth parameters during
  a prefetch. Instead we prepopulate the list via the instances method.
- Added a flush method to do updates more efficiently
- Changed is_public property to accept true/false in addition to yes/no
  and to munge to a symbol instead of a capitalized string, for
  consistency with keystone_tenant's enabled property
- Move the reset method into the spec tests since it is only necessary
  for testing
- Added tests for glance_image, which did not exist before
- Removed connection retry test since this is taken care of in
  openstacklib

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-openstackclient/+bug/1269821

blueprint use-openstackclient-in-module-resources

Change-Id: Iceab5e1c6138e7aba0f883ed4acb8f7ecbcd2830
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/80/172580/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Load the Glance provider library to help require File.join(File.dirname(__FILE__), '..','..','..', 'puppet/provider/glance') Puppet::Type.type(:glance_image).provide( :glance, :parent => Puppet::Provider::Glance ) do desc <<-EOT Glance provider to manage glance_image type. Assumes that the glance-api service is on the same host and is working. EOT commands :glance => 'glance' mk_resource_methods def self.instances list_glance_images.collect do |image| attrs = get_glance_image_attrs(image) new( :ensure => :present, :name => attrs['name'], :is_public => attrs['is_public'], :container_format => attrs['container_format'], :id => attrs['id'], :disk_format => attrs['disk_format'] ) end end def self.prefetch(resources) images = instances resources.keys.each do |name| if provider = images.find{ |pkg| pkg.name == name } resources[name].provider = provider end end end def exists? @property_hash[:ensure] == :present end def create if resource[:source] # copy_from cannot handle file:// if resource[:source] =~ /^\// # local file location = "--file=#{resource[:source]}" else location = "--copy-from=#{resource[:source]}" end # location cannot handle file:// # location does not import, so no sense in doing anything more than this elsif resource[:location] location = "--location=#{resource[:location]}" else raise(Puppet::Error, "Must specify either source or location") end results = auth_glance('image-create', "--name=#{resource[:name]}", "--is-public=#{resource[:is_public]}", "--container-format=#{resource[:container_format]}", "--disk-format=#{resource[:disk_format]}", location) id = nil # Check the old behavior of the python-glanceclient if results =~ /Added new image with ID: (\S+)/ id = $1 else # the new behavior doesn't print the status, so parse the table results_array = parse_table(results) results_array.each do |result| if result["Property"] == "id" id = result["Value"] end end end if id @property_hash = { :ensure => :present, :name => resource[:name], :is_public => resource[:is_public], :container_format => resource[:container_format], :disk_format => resource[:disk_format], :id => id } else fail("did not get expected message from image creation, got #{results}") end end def destroy auth_glance('image-delete', id) @property_hash[:ensure] = :absent end def is_public=(value) auth_glance('image-update', id, "--is-public=#{value}") end def disk_format=(value) auth_glance('image-update', id, "--disk-format=#{value}") end def container_format=(value) auth_glance('image-update', id, "--container-format=#{value}") end def id=(id) fail('id is read only') end end

commit_message:
Add a test server

The start of a test server that allows testing the Heat UI locally.
Regular SimpleHTTP won't work due to lack of CORS headers.

Change-Id: I95a472e3e0fabad49fd03d1a54956ed0e1f1667e

added_lines: #!/bin/env python import SimpleHTTPServer import SocketServer class AllowOriginRequestHandler(SimpleHTTPServer.SimpleHTTPRequestHandler): def end_headers(self): self.send_header("Access-Control-Allow-Origin", "*") SimpleHTTPServer.SimpleHTTPRequestHandler.end_headers(self) if __name__ == '__main__': PORT = 18001 httpd = SocketServer.TCPServer(("", PORT), AllowOriginRequestHandler) print "serving at port", PORT httpd.serve_forever()

commit_message:
Fix the claimed expires_at & created_at timestamps for Fernet

This changes the timestamps in the token body to match the timestamps
that Fernet actually "persists" inside the Fernet token itself, which
are based on integers, not floats.

Change-Id: I1b7607bea25198d4431e4891b1ed0504d9ed9f94
Closes-Bug: 1459790
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/21/208021/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Override the microsecond-level precision requested by the manager # layer because Fernet cannot persist non-integer timestamps. Both the # creation timestamp and expiration timestamp are based on an integer # timestamp in the Fernet spec itself (outside of the message payload), # plus an integer TTL (inside the message payload) to compute the # expiration. MICROSECONDS = '.000000Z' token_data['token']['expires_at'] = ( token_data['token']['expires_at'][:-len(MICROSECONDS)] + MICROSECONDS) token_data['token']['issued_at'] = ( token_data['token']['issued_at'][:-len(MICROSECONDS)] + MICROSECONDS)

commit_message:
Fixes an issue with data ordering in the tests

In my most recent dev setups the order that the data is returned is
different that what is expected. Since we don't explicitly user an order
clause with our query I'm not checking the order anymore.

Change-Id: I427cacdd7d147b9778b3dbc8da2a9fa2bbd4943d

commit_message:
Cast Int64 values to float

Currently MongoDB and HBase return integer values from samples and statistics,
but wsme expected a float type.
In this CR MongoDB and HBase statistics and sample values cast to float.

Change-Id: I97ccf8f8cd10e065ebd80ccbe1a688bf8d722b2f
Closes-Bug: #1474031

In order to standardize the way dbsync are run across our modules,

nodes, include nova::api on every node with sync_db set to false
and have the ENC return nova::db::sync just for one node.

commit_message:
Creation of nova::db::sync

In order to standardize the way dbsync are run across our modules,
we create a new class nova::db::sync.
This class will be included if sync_db is enabled.

By making this transition the nova::db::sync class
can be returned by the ENC.

A use case would be in an highly available environment, with 3 galera
nodes, include nova::api on every node with sync_db set to false
and have the ENC return nova::db::sync just for one node.

Change-Id: I795178f83fe5b997a2574fe17263643688efc48c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/79/196679/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'nova::db::sync' do shared_examples_for 'nova-dbsync' do it 'runs nova-db-sync' do is_expected.to contain_exec('nova-db-sync').with( :command => '/usr/bin/nova-manage db sync', :refreshonly => 'true', :logoutput => 'on_failure' ) end end context 'on a RedHat osfamily' do let :facts do { :osfamily => 'RedHat', :operatingsystemrelease => '7.0', :concat_basedir => '/var/lib/puppet/concat' } end it_configures 'nova-dbsync' end context 'on a Debian osfamily' do let :facts do { :operatingsystemrelease => '7.8', :operatingsystem => 'Debian', :osfamily => 'Debian', :concat_basedir => '/var/lib/puppet/concat' } end it_configures 'nova-dbsync' end end

commit_message:
Creation of sahara::db::sync

In order to standardize the way dbsync are run across our modules,
we create a new class sahara::db::sync.
This class will be included if sync_db is enabled.

By making this transition the sahara::db::sync class
can be returned by the ENC.

A use case would be in an highly available environment, with 3 galera
nodes, include sahara on every node with sync_db set to false
and have the ENC return sahara::db::sync just for one node.

Change-Id: Ibdf6f86e546868b4fcfa0f530287e712934808fd

commit_message:
Make use_syslog=True log to syslog via /dev/log

After upgrade from Icehouse to Juno OpenStack services don't log to
syslog via /dev/log anymore. This behaviour was introduced in commit
1188d88a73e75da5c143d0dfad34e10dad0daee0. While /dev/log is arguably
not a very portable default, breaking the backwards compatibility is
even worse.

This commit restores the original behaviour. /dev/log portability
issues will be addressed separately.

Closes-Bug: #1385295
Related-Bug: #1391428

(cherry picked from commit ac4330dd674b073c4d31ef87e61710015ffe6c80)
Conflicts:
	openstack/common/log.py

Change-Id: I4e84bca70eee6d6aa8d7525fe38d65ba235dd6b0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/43/202943/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: syslog = RFCSysLogHandler(address='/dev/log', facility=facility) else: syslog = logging.handlers.SysLogHandler(address='/dev/log', facility=facility)

commit_message:
Add 2 callbacks to processutils.execute()

Add optional on_execute and on_completion callbacks to allow callers of
procesutils.execute() to track process completion asynchronously.

This could be used to cache the pid of long running tasks associated
with an instance and then clear the cache when the process completes.
While the tasks are running should it be required the pid retrieved and
the process can be signaled.

Conflicts:
        oslo/concurrency/processutils.py
        openstack/common/processutils.py

Co-Authored-By: abhishekkekane <abhishek.kekane@nttdata.com>
Change-Id: Ifc23325eddb523f6449ba06a2deb0885a8a7009d
(cherry picked from commit 3c6bcf4cd62302f949e47f1102fa7f986e82c596)
(cherry picked from commit 6bf29bd813c611cba9c161d3426e1cd745721676)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/91/209791/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :param on_execute: This function will be called upon process creation with the object as a argument. The Purpose of this is to allow the caller of `processutils.execute` to track process creation asynchronously. :type on_execute: function(:class:`subprocess.Popen`) :param on_completion: This function will be called upon process completion with the object as a argument. The Purpose of this is to allow the caller of `processutils.execute` to track process completion asynchronously. :type on_completion: function(:class:`subprocess.Popen`) on_execute = kwargs.pop('on_execute', None) on_completion = kwargs.pop('on_completion', None) if on_execute: on_execute(obj) if on_completion: on_completion(obj)

commit_message:
Test the claimed expires_at & created_at timestamps for Fernet

This tests to ensure that the timestamps in the token body are
consistently returned from both the v2 and v3 APIs.

Change-Id: Idbedd9c13791b436844b76f5d7a3caeb39060f27
Related-Bug: 1459790

subject: Fix test_relationships() for subobject versions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-06 21:58:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ed03bb73cadd2efddce61a2897f6a7460c00d79f', 'message': 'Fix test_relationships() for subobject versions

When the tree for all subobjects of objects is built, the desired
subobject version should be retrieved from obj_relationships of the
object. This should then be tested against the static tree to see if the
versions in the objects matches the static tree.

Because some versioning got stale, objects (or the static tree) needed
to be fixed up to reflect the correct versions of objects.

Closes-Bug: #1471978

Change-Id: I99f720725c9a3e7902de39e9aee533caa2c73847
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-08 14:40:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/bd7d2dd4fcf2698a05bc705a88bc8e890a477814', 'message': 'Fix test_relationships() for subobject versions

When the tree for all subobjects of objects is built, the desired
subobject version should be retrieved from obj_relationships of the
object. This should then be tested against the static tree to see if the
versions in the objects matches the static tree.

Because some versioning got stale, objects (or the static tree) needed
to be fixed up to reflect the correct versions of objects.

Closes-Bug: #1471978

Change-Id: I99f720725c9a3e7902de39e9aee533caa2c73847
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-08 16:03:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d11c8c01b1b2c5ebd3950a2e38b2ac18fe988f40', 'message': 'Fix test_relationships() for subobject versions

test_relationships() should be testing the versions of subobjects held
in obj_relationships to the current versions of the subobjects. A static
tree was used to maintain the current versions before, and that static
tree was checked against the current version of subobjects. This is now
changed over to have a tree with the current version of the subobjects,
and a tree with the version held in the most recent entry in
obj_relationships within the object.

Because some versioning got stale, objects needed
to be updated to contain the correct versions of subobjects.

Closes-Bug: #1471978

Change-Id: I99f720725c9a3e7902de39e9aee533caa2c73847

commit_message:
Fix test_relationships() for subobject versions

test_relationships() should be testing the versions of subobjects held
in obj_relationships to the current versions of the subobjects. A static
tree was used to maintain the current versions before, and that static
tree was checked against the current version of subobjects. This is now
changed over to have a tree with the current version of the subobjects,
and a tree with the version held in the most recent entry in
obj_relationships within the object.

Because some versioning got stale, objects needed
to be updated to contain the correct versions of subobjects.

Closes-Bug: #1471978

Change-Id: I99f720725c9a3e7902de39e9aee533caa2c73847

commit_message:
Remove unused setUp for RevokeTests

The setUp code is unused and invalid since it refers to a
"Manger" symbol that isn't defined.

self.revoke_api is created by load_backends already, so no
setUp is needed.

Change-Id: I0a3f69851f9a1a81292d3d69cb1172165612ef92

commit_message:
cleanup NovaObjectDictCompat from virt_cpu_topology

cleanup subclassing on NovaObjectDictCompat and fix subsequent
tests and code associated with nova/objects/virt_cpu_topology.py

Due to the exhaustive nature of changes, the cleanup is done
one object at a time.

This is the fourth patch of the series.
There shall be more patches to follow for other objects.

Related to blueprint liberty-objects

Change-Id: I6c4ed28faf0bccf169faec295b410e764f70db5c

commit_message:
Fix os-ansible-deployment doc merging

os-ansible-deployment has documentation in the repository. When
reviews are submitted for these docs the normal gate checks
are skipped as the docs have no bearing on the success of the
project's general software building.

This patch adds the noop template to allow the skipped jobs
to still be processed by zuul and therefore allow a merge.

Change-Id: I561c248da53e9d781cbd4d569cf55dea412daade
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/79/210379/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # note that docs in the repo will skip the check and # gate jobs, so noop-jobs is added to allow skipped # jobs to merge - name: noop-jobs

commit_message:
Project Admin Quota support for Domains

Project Admin user requires special consideration for certain actions
that by default are not supported with current policy & token checks.
This patch attempts to allow a Project Admin user the ability to
manage quotas for a project they administer.

Partially Implements: blueprint domain-scoped-tokens

Change-Id: I8f87c92dcc2c32b1e609b7a6ce61135f74c88d20
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/77/201277/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: project_admin = False try: has_project_id = request.user.token.project.get('id') is_admin = request.user.is_superuser project_admin = has_project_id and is_admin except Exception: LOG.error("Failed to retrieve user token") return project_admin if is_project_admin(request): project = request.user.project_id # cloud_admin will set domain and project to None by default # if is_cloud_admin(request): # domain = None # project = None

subject: Hide Quota/Usage table actions for non Cloud-Admin
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-02 21:50:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/d401c9cf8b4905d6be54a66976962cbb5c99c961', 'message': 'WIP - Hide Quota/Usage table actions re Domains

When domain scoped tokens are used against keysone v3, the Domain Admin
user should not have the permissions to manage or list quotas, nor the
permissions to view usages for projects. These table actions should be
removed within the Identity/Projects table if the logged in user is not
the Cloud Admin.

Depends on a Horizon configured with a keystone v3 policy file, e.g.:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/162325

Relates to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/141153/

Background on how to test is here
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Horizon/DomainWorkFlow

Partially Implements: blueprint domain-scoped-tokens

Change-Id: Ib7d6717cc11370edfad5c13db2ca53bacc0b1423

commit_message:
Hide Quota/Usage table actions for non Cloud-Admin

When domain scoped tokens are used against keysone v3, the Domain Admin
user should not have the permissions to manage or list quotas, nor the
permissions to view usages for projects. These table actions should be
removed within the Identity/Projects table if the logged in user is not
the Cloud Admin.

Depends on a Horizon configured with a keystone v3 policy file, e.g.:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/162325

Relates to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/141153/

Background on how to test is here
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Horizon/DomainWorkFlow

Partially Implements: blueprint domain-scoped-tokens

Closes-Bug: 1462020
Change-Id: Ib7d6717cc11370edfad5c13db2ca53bacc0b1423

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import unittest import mock from networking_odl.common import utils class TestGetAddressesByName(unittest.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestGetAddressesByName, self).setUp() self.clear_cache() self.addCleanup(self.clear_cache) def clear_cache(self): utils._addresses_by_name_cache.clear() @mock.patch.object(utils, 'socket') def test_get_addresses_by_valid_name(self, mocked_socket): mocked_socket.getaddrinfo.return_value =\ [(2, 1, 6, '', ('127.0.0.1', 0)), (2, 2, 17, '', ('127.0.0.1', 0)), (2, 3, 0, '', ('127.0.0.1', 0)), (2, 1, 6, '', ('10.237.214.247', 0)), (2, 2, 17, '', ('10.237.214.247', 0)), (2, 3, 0, '', ('10.237.214.247', 0))] # When given valid name is request result = utils.get_addresses_by_name('some_host_name') # Then returns right addresses self.assertEqual(('10.237.214.247', '127.0.0.1'), result) # Then result is cached self.assertIs(result, utils.get_addresses_by_name('some_host_name')) # Then result is fetched only once mocked_socket.getaddrinfo.assert_called_once_with( 'some_host_name', None) @mock.patch.object(utils, 'socket') def test_get_addresses_by_invalid_name(self, mocked_socket): def mocked_getaddrinfo(name, service): raise RuntimeError() mocked_socket.getaddrinfo.side_effect = mocked_getaddrinfo with self.assertRaises(RuntimeError): # When given invalid name is request utils.get_addresses_by_name('some_host_name') with self.assertRaises(RuntimeError): # When given invalid name is request again utils.get_addresses_by_name('some_host_name') # Then result is fetched more times mocked_socket.getaddrinfo.assert_has_calls( [mock.call('some_host_name', None), mock.call('some_host_name', None)])

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/46/210346/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import collections import requestsfrom oslo_serialization import jsonutilsfrom networking_odl.openstack.common._i18n import _LI # Search for the first valid segment vif_type = portbindings.VIF_TYPE_OVS try: topology = self._get_network_topology() assert isinstance(topology, collections.Mapping) except Exception: LOG.exception(_LE('Unable to get network topology')) return vif_type _network_topology = None def _get_network_topology(self): topology = self._network_topology if topology is None: LOG.info(_LI('Get network topology from ODL.')) response = self.client.get( 'restconf/operational/network-topology:network-topology/') self._network_topology = topology = response.json() if LOG.isEnabledFor(logging.logging.DEBUG): topology_str = jsonutils.dumps( topology, sort_keys=True, indent=4, separators=(',', ': ')) LOG.debug("Got network topology:\n%s", topology_str) return topology

commit_message:
Setting default values for languagepack admin creds

Currently the default values are not set (empty). Due to this
languagepack build fails in vagrant/devstack setup.
So setting the default values that are appropriate from vagrant/devstack
setup point-of-view.

In real deployment these creds should be set to the lp admin user
that is created in the system

Change-Id: I55700b00b06e99184f8bfad1128d6208f5ff7ad7

commit_message:
Remove un-related nova quota in test data

volumes and gigabytes are cinder quotas, it should be removed
from nova test data.

This also fixes test issue on Defaults panel when running in
Django1.8 because of stricter checking in assertQuerysetequal().

Closes-Bug: #1482509
Partially Implements: blueprint django18

Change-Id: I9d5d1388e4b8a3e02a9340d1c84907f0ba8aa510

commit_message:
Allow to update master node from official channel

- Made UPDATE_FUEL_MIRROR url providing optional
cause we need to update master in upgrade tests with updates
from official channel. UPDATE_FUEL_MIRROR allows us to provide
proposed repos.

Change-Id: I3901874f3853948c480821f18c6f0dbc7d5c0bad
Closes-Bug: #1480976

from official channel. UPDATE_FUEL_MIRROR allows us to provide
proposed repos.

commit_message:
Allow to update master node from official channel

- Made UPDATE_FUEL_MIRROR url providing optional
cause we need to update master in upgrade tests with updates
from official channel. UPDATE_FUEL_MIRROR allows us to provide
proposed repos.

Change-Id: I3901874f3853948c480821f18c6f0dbc7d5c0bad
Closes-Bug: #1480976

commit_message:
Avoid using the global lockutils semaphore collection

Instead of using the shared for all semaphore collection that
is by default used in oslo.concurrency lockutils its preferable
for a library such as oslo.service to use its own semaphore collection
to avoid becoming blocked by some other code due to sharing the same
default oslo.concurrency semaphore collection.

Change-Id: Id3f54b5897f884324b31db3288d663a171b48447

commit_message:
Wrap iterators and 'dict_items' for py34 compatibitity

Change iterators and 'dict_items' objects to list with additional 'list()' method
to avoid versions incompatibility

Partially-Implements: bp py3-compatibility

Change-Id: Ic6b437cd0d57ca3d4b343b590d11c4e53492d223

commit_message:
Relaxed eslint peer dependency

Until we get proper dependency synchronization for javascript, it
makes more sense to use fuzzy peer dependencies. Relaxing this only
for peer dependencies means that this project remains stable,
however downstream consumers can set up their own versions.

Change-Id: I43896eaacd7d766c63ef71eec67e76ddca840089

subject: Add ability to use HTTPS port
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-04 16:31:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-nailgun-agent/commit/27c2767b101138bef290d882348cf47566b8b513', 'message': 'Add ability to use HTTPS port

As long as we have HTTPS enabled by default on master node,
it would be nice to use secure channel for nailgun agent. So,
this commit switch to HTTPS as default protocol for agent and
allow to use plain HTTP as a fallback.

Change-Id: I570890b19eac74db6f3666af966e86f64327740d

commit_message:
Add ability to use HTTPS port

As long as we have HTTPS enabled by default on master node,
it would be nice to use secure channel for nailgun agent. So,
this commit switch to HTTPS as default protocol for agent and
allow to use plain HTTP as a fallback.
We use SSL no_verify for connection cause now certificate for
master node nginx generated on container creation and we don't
have an ability to easily push it to trusted on bootstrap node.

Change-Id: I570890b19eac74db6f3666af966e86f64327740d
Closes-Bug: #1480866

commit_message:
Port NetApp NFS drivers to use ABC driver model

NetApp NFS drivers inherit from NfsDriver, which in turn
inherits from RemoteFSDriver.  Now that RemoteFSDriver and
NfsDriver have been ported to the ABC driver model, we have ported
the NetApp NFS drivers as well.

Change-Id: I785d0bb282589cab9efee60ab7900e09d54bb7e0
Partially-implements: blueprint abc-driver-update

commit_message:
Add extra spec capability for Nimble Cinder Driver

Supported Extra Specs are

1. Performance Policy Name
nimble:perfpol-name = <Performance Policy Name>

2. Encryption
nimble:encryption = "yes"

Implements: blueprint nimble-add-extra-specs-support

Change-Id: I45a18b189746b778f10eecbf669be7943828e28b

commit_message:
Add irqbalance to apt package list

This patch adds irqbalance to the apt package list to resolve
the issue where a deployer may not have the package installed
in their base OS deployment.

Change-Id: I968c483fd6eb926f32d55b3761574a6d3c3139b9
Closes-Bug: #1482146

commit_message:
Use contextlib.closing instead of try ... finally: sock.close

Change-Id: Ia78e9ee71b5419ce395031528dd9c17d75511e95
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.service refs/changes/01/209301/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import contextlib with contextlib.closing(sock): try: sock.connect(_abstractify(notify_socket)) sock.sendall(msg) if unset_env: del os.environ['NOTIFY_SOCKET'] except EnvironmentError: LOG.debug("Systemd notification failed", exc_info=True) with contextlib.closing(sock): try: msg = sock.recv(512) except socket.timeout: return 2 if 'READY=1' in msg: return 0 else: return 1
deleted_lines: try: sock.connect(_abstractify(notify_socket)) sock.sendall(msg) if unset_env: del os.environ['NOTIFY_SOCKET'] except EnvironmentError: LOG.debug("Systemd notification failed", exc_info=True) finally: sock.close() try: msg = sock.recv(512) except socket.timeout: return 2 finally: sock.close() if 'READY=1' in msg: return 0 else: return 1

commit_message:
update cinder.conf on cinder node

 Add auth_uri, indentity_uri and auth_strategy
 they needed for cinder-volume service

Closes-Bug: #1482239

Change-Id: I874bb83e2b42329f1ccc714af6565f963ff7aa68
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/17/210217/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $keystone_auth_protocol = 'http' $keystone_auth_host = $service_endpoint $service_port = '5000' $auth_uri = "${keystone_auth_protocol}://${keystone_auth_host}:${service_port}/" $identity_uri = "${keystone_auth_protocol}://${keystone_auth_host}:${service_port}/" keystone_enabled => true, vmware_host_password => $vcenter_hash['vc_password'], auth_uri => $auth_uri, identity_uri => $identity_uri,

commit_message:
Check that sighup is supported before accessing signal.SIGHUP

Use string representations of signals when adding a handler to
avoid AttribureError in case a signal is not supported on a
certain platform.
Fixed a check for sighup support in add_handler method.
Added the add_handlers method that allows to add several handlers
at once and remove this functionality from add_handler to prevent
recursive calls in case we pass a tuple of strings.

Change-Id: Id3783160381f4a89e241134ef13c4521a30dfa94
Closes-Bug: #1481607

commit_message:
Properly parse and quote arguments in upgrade script

This patch fixes the following:

1. Properly quote arguments to run_lock function
2. Properly parse out the playbook filename in run_lock

Specifically the upgrade steps where we were using

   "-e 'rabbitmq_upgrade=true' setup-infrastructure.yml"
   "/tmp/fix_container_interfaces.yml || true"

Were causing issues and this patch resolves them.

Closes-bug: 1479916
Change-Id: I809085d6da493f7f7d545547a0d984c0e7b1bf45
(cherry picked from commit 560fbbdb077c0f8d6f8bfa9b48e967ccef86664a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/46/208546/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: file_part="${run_item}" # NOTE(sigmavirus24): This handles tasks like: # "-e 'rabbitmq_upgrade=true' setup-infrastructure.yml" # "/tmp/fix_container_interfaces.yml || true" # So we can get the appropriate basename for the upgrade_marker for part in $run_item; do if [[ "$part" == *.yml ]];then file_part="$part" break fi done upgrade_marker_file=$(basename ${file_part} .yml) # NOTE(sigmavirus24): Use eval so that we properly turn strings like # "/tmp/fix_container_interfaces.yml || true" # Into a command, otherwise we'll get an error that there's no playbook # named || eval "openstack-ansible $2" run_lock $item "${RUN_TASKS[$item]}"

commit_message:
Implements list_resources limit/ordering

This change implements limit and ordering
for the listing of resource.

It also adds a [api]/max_limit to limit the number of
elements returned, to avoid too many memory consumption
on the server side.

Partial bug: #1479830

Change-Id: I9f4a7557809b04934adcef268f45b0fbb4ec0826

subject: Add check for existing plugin
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-28 22:35:20.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/0067fc976cfa13273519dc3d4571e6b64207ba44', 'message': "Add check for existing plugin

If you call enable_plugin twice with the same name, the details are
updated correctly, however the plugin name gets added a second time to
the list.  This causes the plugin code to be executed twice and you'll
end up with two sets of processes running.

A check was added to enable_plugin so that the name only gets added
to the list if it doesn't already exist.

Change-Id: Ifabfda444aed65467788b5e46a0cafe2a3b7883d
"}]
commit_message:
Add check for existing plugin

If you call enable_plugin twice with the same name, the details are
updated correctly, however the plugin name gets added a second time to
the list.  This causes the plugin code to be executed twice and you'll
end up with two sets of processes running.

A check was added to enable_plugin so that the name only gets added
to the list if it doesn't already exist.

Change-Id: Ifabfda444aed65467788b5e46a0cafe2a3b7883d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/50/206750/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ ! ,$DEVSTACK_PLUGINS, =~ ,$name, ]]; then DEVSTACK_PLUGINS+=",$name" fi

commit_message:
Allow to get option from paste-deploy

This change allows any middleware that use oslo.config to
be configured via paste-deploy, like the cors does.

Related-bug: #1482086
Change-Id: Ibb3e951b45b51c9bc602c9113df18a58226d92d1

commit_message:
Replace (int, long) with six.integer_types

Python 3 hasn't type 'long', there is only integer type 'int',
which mostly behaves like the long type in Python 2.

Partially-Implements: bp py3-compatibility

Change-Id: I78eb93837cbe137c9ce4dd1b3cf0f4744696ade4

commit_message:
jenkins/copy-puppet-logs: run the publisher all the time

Whatever job status, we need to run the publisher so we can have the
logs and debug why it's failing.

Change-Id: Ie3c223abad0a51b5e5383be7e0a4067dd9db8e48

commit_message:
Fix issue with multiple notification listeners

Adds searchlight specific topic for glance which
resolves the conflict with ceilometer and other
services which also consume glance notifications

Closes-Bug: #1470627
Change-Id: Iae28a1527fa93bca4de59fd272eb29b5cbb30fee

commit_message:
Replace 'types.StringTypes' with 'six.string_types'

In Python 3 'types' module no longer has 'StringTypes' attribute.
We replace it with 'six.string_types' for Python 3 compatibility

Partially-Implements: bp py3-compatibility

Change-Id: If502da3114c96b722d1b7ccc7db6336291b2f115
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/89/207789/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six if isinstance(c, six.string_types): assert isinstance(child.nodeValue, six.string_types), msg
deleted_lines: import types if isinstance(c, types.StringTypes): assert isinstance(child.nodeValue, types.StringTypes), msg

commit_message:
Make direct call to object's obj_from_primitive

The following patch fixes field.Object's from_primitive()
to call a given object's obj_from_primitive() instead of
VersionedObject's obj_from_primitive().  By using the given
object instead of VersionedObject, the appropriate
OBJ_PROJECT_NAMESPACE is passed down to obj_from_primitive(),
and allows support for other projects namespaces.

Change-Id: I02e733f29ce2ee221270577f6dafdda706c74eb2
Closes-Bug: #1479041
Signed-off-by: Thang Pham <thang.g.pham@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.versionedobjects refs/changes/37/206637/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return obj.obj_from_primitive(value, obj._context)

commit_message:
Fix prepare for deployment for 7.0 version

* Rename NodeCollection.prepare_for_deployment to
  prepare_for_6_1_deployment.
* Add prepare_for_deployment method for 7.0 that allocates IPs for all networks
  which have non-empty 'notation' (networks can be added/removed arbitrary in 7.0).
* Fix tests for orchestrator serializer
* Fix Private networks description. 'render_addr_mask' is not relevant for 7.0 serializer.

Closes-Bug: #1477643
Change-Id: I27133d15fff23d0ac0c9755c7356bac7d730b317

commit_message:
libvirt: don't open connection in driver constructor

Calling host.has_min_version triggers opening of a new
libvirt connection. This should not ever be done in the
constructor of LibvirtDriver class, as the 'host_init'
method must be allowed to run first during normal Nova
compute service startup.

This mistake was introduced in

  commit 9a09674220a071e51fdca7911b52c0027c01ff64
  Author: Vladik Romanovsky <vromanso@redhat.com>
  Date:   Wed Oct 15 14:42:37 2014 -0400

    libvirt: enable virtio-net multiqueue

and is thought to also be causing instability in the
unit tests in the gate.

Avoid the problem by passing the Host object instance
into the VIF driver get_config method, instead of
trying to pass a flag into its constructor.

Closes-Bug: #1482230
Change-Id: Ic940d6ffc5b7d664540363b8bcbea23c7bc7d9dd

commit_message:
Revert "Fix scenario test fails when port_vnic_type is set"

This reverts commit 0a03b7a37a20c206932206eea8602d9f4b009ae9.

It looks we broke a working CI which tests SRIOV. Revert this and then
figure what happened. Note: in the future it would be great to have
these external CI publish their results.

Change-Id: I52f7ae49ccd08ce6badb45f201d83c6af172bafe

commit_message:
Make add-select work on static pages

Before it was impossible to 'Add application' button from statically
rendered form page. This happened, because js callbacks were only
executed during modal form init. This patch adds an additional call of
js code in add-select in case the page being rendered is a static one.

Change-Id: Ia628a0b37bf12c3db2ec18287fc8afe4561186fd
Closes-Bug: #1417420

commit_message:
Postpone setting fipAssigned attribute until stack successful push

Instance class set fipAssigned attribute attribute indicating that it has
assigned floating IP address prior to stack.push() if then stack push
failed on a subsequent deployments Instance didn't tried to allocate
FIP again

Change-Id: Ic467d7f4dc3b248c4f8f55be7997a4d2d90924a3
Closes-Bug: #1482217
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/78/210078/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - If: $.floatingIpAddress != null Then: $.setAttr(fipAssigned, true)

commit_message:
Updated package-import help description

Improved category metavar.
Removed incorrect note of possibility to use comma in categorie list
Added note about possibility to use -- to separate positional FILE
arguments from the rest of arguments.

Change-Id: Ia6e8f7c35bfb912d526db23a6bf8e766e7765187
Closes-Bug: #1478912
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-muranoclient refs/changes/19/209919/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @utils.arg('-c', '--categories', metavar='<CATEGORY>', nargs='*', You can use `--` to separate `FILE`s from other arguments. Categories have to be separated with a space and have to be already present in murano.
deleted_lines: @utils.arg('-c', '--categories', metavar='<CAT1 CAT2 CAT3>', nargs='*', `categories` can be separated by a comma.

commit_message:
devstack: only use 1 thread

I don't think anything in Aodh WSGI is thread-safe, and I have
absolutely no clue about how threading.local works with the thread
mod_wsgi creates. That maybe the source of the issue we see in bug

Depends-On: I001e34e28353a35148e2101ab90cb3d238bd53cb
Change-Id: Ib7d937d95b4fb8a5ece462542c40c54c88d8ae50
Closes-Bug: #1481244
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/aodh refs/changes/65/210065/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: WSGIDaemonProcess aodh-api processes=%APIWORKERS% threads=1 user=%USER% display-name=%{GROUP} %VIRTUALENV%
deleted_lines: WSGIDaemonProcess aodh-api processes=%APIWORKERS% threads=10 user=%USER% display-name=%{GROUP} %VIRTUALENV%

commit_message:
Testing Ubuntu bootstrap instead Centos

BVT to verify Ubuntu bootstrap instead Centos
* switching to Ubuntu bootstrap via
  fuel-bootstrap-image-set ubuntu" command after
  reverting "ready" snapshot
* verifying that bootstrap is Ubuntu after:
     - initial bootstraping slaves
     - stop deployment
     - reset cluster
     - delete cluster

Change-Id: Iba21429d0ed1c61f98031092ef7d06c1479f3960
Related-Bug:#1481826
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/75/209575/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import time from proboscis import test from fuelweb_test.helpers.decorators import log_snapshot_after_test from fuelweb_test.settings import DEPLOYMENT_MODE from fuelweb_test.settings import NEUTRON_SEGMENT_TYPE from fuelweb_test.helpers import os_actions from fuelweb_test import logger from fuelweb_test.tests.base_test_case import SetupEnvironment from fuelweb_test.tests.base_test_case import TestBasic @test(groups=["ubuntu_bootstrap"]) class UbuntuBootstrap(TestBasic): """UbuntuBootstrap.""" # TODO documentation @test(depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_release], groups=["ubuntu_bootstrap"]) @log_snapshot_after_test def change_bootstrap_to_ubuntu(self): """Provision new cluster with Ubuntu bootstrap instead Centos Scenario: 1. Revert snapshot "ready" 2. Run script on master node to change bootstrap to Ubuntu 3. Bootstrap slaves 4. Create cluster with default values 6. Create snapshot of environment Duration 30m """ self.env.revert_snapshot("ready") self.fuel_web.client.get_root() # Run script on master node to change bootstrap to Ubuntu with self.env.d_env.get_admin_remote() as remote: cmd = 'fuel-bootstrap-image-set ubuntu' remote.execute(cmd) time.sleep(60) self.env.bootstrap_nodes( self.env.d_env.nodes().slaves[:1]) cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, mode=DEPLOYMENT_MODE, settings={ "net_provider": 'neutron', "net_segment_type": NEUTRON_SEGMENT_TYPE } ) logger.info('cluster is %s' % str(cluster_id)) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, {'slave-01': ['controller']} ) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) os_conn = os_actions.OpenStackActions( self.fuel_web.get_public_vip(cluster_id)) self.fuel_web.assert_cluster_ready(os_conn, smiles_count=4, networks_count=2, timeout=300) self.fuel_web.run_single_ostf_test( cluster_id=cluster_id, test_sets=['sanity'], test_name=('fuel_health.tests.sanity.test_sanity_identity' '.SanityIdentityTest.test_list_users')) self.env.make_snapshot("ubuntu_bootstrap")

commit_message:
complete remove extra blank todo: fixes missing floating ip docs

Note that this line was stopping code execution for the libcloud version so
that step 14 was not being displayed. This meant that there was no description
of how to attach a floating ip to an instance.

Change-Id: Ia9d6ef7486ff14bcc94f74ae6b593b7265da9d33

subject: Use token creation ts from Fernet
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-06 17:57:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/181427e87139204fcca769d3af61bf777500eb51', 'message': 'Removed WIP tests for Fernet

We were skipping some tests for the Fernet provider because of the ms issue
documented in bug 1459790. These tests are passing now, so we can remove the
override from the TestFernetTokenAPIs class.

Change-Id: I66e9d89da7f05b21726db65cc51c765b07c0cd41
Related-Bug: 1459790
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-06 20:50:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/f7f2cec0b07d850d1562cf736ac960d94c6b32ca', 'message': "Use token creation ts from Fernet

Previously, we were generating token timestamps much like we do with the other
token formats in Keystone. This will have to change with Fernet tokens because
according to the Fernet specification, Fernet creates and encodes the token
creation timestamp outside of the token's payload. We should only use one
timestamp, generated in a single place, versus returning a timestamp that we
create on to creation but changes when the token is validated because Fernet
uses something else.

Change-Id: I66e9d89da7f05b21726db65cc51c765b07c0cd41
Related-Bug: 1459790
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-06 21:01:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/669fe5c805bf67425761a30d5622a29fe0487bd7', 'message': "Use token creation ts from Fernet

Previously, we were generating token timestamps much like we do with the other
token formats in Keystone. This will have to change with Fernet tokens because
according to the Fernet specification, Fernet creates and encodes the token
creation timestamp outside of the token's payload. We should only use one
timestamp, generated in a single place, versus returning a timestamp that we
create on to creation but changes when the token is validated because Fernet
uses something else.

commit_message:
Use token creation ts from Fernet

Previously, we were generating token timestamps much like we do with the other
token formats in Keystone. This will have to change with Fernet tokens because
according to the Fernet specification, Fernet creates and encodes the token
creation timestamp outside of the token's payload. We should only use one
timestamp, generated in a single place, versus returning a timestamp that we
create on to creation but changes when the token is validated because Fernet
uses something else.

Change-Id: I66e9d89da7f05b21726db65cc51c765b07c0cd41
Related-Bug: 1459790

commit_message:
Add image status table to Image service v2.0

Change-Id: I511aae80a5d6ae6c9262518347aa59adc011fad6
Closes-Bug: #1333705
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-site refs/changes/38/209738/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
None. The possible status values are:
Image statuses
Status Description
queued Only the image identifier has been reserved for an image in the Glance registry. No image data has been uploaded.
saving An image's raw data is currently being uploaded to Glance.
active An image that is fully available in Glance.
killed An error occured during the uploading of an image's data.
deleted Glance retained the information about the image, but it is no longer available to use.
pending_delete Similar to deleted. An image in this state is not recoverable.

commit_message:
Enable entry points for new declarative meters

Include the new entry point for meters notifications
and deprecate the migrated ones. Also add the exchange
controls to the notification agent directly.

As a first step, this commit converts glance, magnetodb
and orchestration meters.

Partially Implements: blueprint declarative-notifications

commit_message:
Fix for rgw still throwing errors

When raising the PollsterPermanentError,
the list of resources(tenants) are passed,
which enables the Agent Manager to blacklist
those resources. This stops those resources
from being polled again and avoids any unwanted
error messages from being logged.

Change-Id: I4f7bf23d5d7f3c182e4089d80b03a1587fa31222
Closes-Bug: #1475441

deleted_lines: except ImportError as e: raise plugin_base.PollsterPermanentError(e)

Filter cgsnapshots data on the DB side

It filters cgsnapshots data on the DB side to improve performance.

Partial-Implements: blueprint data-filtering-on-the-db-side
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/63/197163/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def cgsnapshot_get_all(context, filters=None): query = model_query(context, models.Cgsnapshot) if filters: for key in filters.keys(): try: getattr(models.Cgsnapshot, key) except AttributeError: LOG.debug("'%s' filter key is not valid.", key) return [] query = query.filter_by(**filters) return query.all()def cgsnapshot_get_all_by_project(context, project_id, filters=None): query = model_query(context, models.Cgsnapshot) if filters: query = query.filter_by(**filters) return query.filter_by(project_id=project_id).all()
deleted_lines: def cgsnapshot_get_all(context): return model_query(context, models.Cgsnapshot).all()def cgsnapshot_get_all_by_project(context, project_id): return model_query(context, models.Cgsnapshot).\ filter_by(project_id=project_id).all()

Add cluster verification checks

Spec describes adding cluster verification checks
bp cluster-verification

APIImpact

Change-Id: I7e39477c522e0ce96672dd0408b85910284727d6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-specs refs/changes/76/196576/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================ Implement Sahara cluster verification checks ============================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/sahara/+spec/cluster-verification Now we don't have any check to take a look at cluster processes status through Sahara interface. Our plans is to implement cluster verification and add button for recheck processes in Horizon. Problem description =================== Sahara doesn't have any check for cluster processes health monitoring. One cluster processes can be broken or unavailable but Sahara will still present it ACTIVE status. Proposed change =============== The good way to implement cluster verification checks is to add functional tests for every processes in every plugin. The status of cluster processes health should be indicated: SUCCESS: True/False, DESCRIPTION(optional): description of problem Cluster can be checked after "Starting" state, need add "Verification" state. Alternatives ------------ As an alternative we can use this checks for testing cluster of scenario tests Data model impact ----------------- Need to add a table to DB with result of verification with column: id, cluster_id, create_at, update_at, checks, status. REST API impact --------------- Need to implement support for new polling service. Other end user impact --------------------- Need to implement requests for run checks via python-saharaclient. Deployer impact --------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None. Sahara-image-elements impact ---------------------------- None. Sahara-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- Dashboard impact is needed to add a button for running cluster verification checks. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: esikachev Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- 1. Implement verification check for each plugin 2. Implement run verification checks via python-saharaclient 3. Implement verification checks button to Horizon Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= New unit tests and integration tests should be written for the feature. Documentation Impact ==================== None. References ========== None.

commit_message:
Update description about /NetworkDriver.EndpointOperInfo

This patch removes the description that says `docker service info`
command calls /NetworkDriver.EndpointOperInfo because it doesn't call it
actually. It seems the interface for the endpoint is not exposed through
Docker CLI at this point.

Change-Id: Ia37c9feedfff9d7f8335a9217c8cde1f3f200798
Signed-off-by: Taku Fukushima <f.tac.mac@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Proposal for migration of image locations

This proposal intends to discuss and plan the image location migrations
as an attempt to get early consensus for development work involved.

Change-Id: I5102d704cb9c1ea5176583293bbfdc04462bdfe9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/81/103981/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Migration for Image locations ========================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/image-locations-migration A change [0] was recently merged into master for removing sensitve user and key information from the image location column for the swift store. Although, it has introduced a way to store new image locations without the sensitive info, there has not been a change in the code to make earlier stored locations safer. This BP proposes to make necessary changes to the Locations Table in the Glance DB to remove the sensitive info from existing locations. * There has been a deferred proposal for migration until PS 57 at [1] which can be used as a point of reference for the change proposed. [0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/98722 [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34801 Problem description =================== * Although, we'd improvements in the code to remove sensitive information from the image locations, the existing data has not been modified. * We need to resolve the security issue of DB containing cleartext password. * Swift backend for Glance does not work after changing the service password. [2] [2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1100220 Proposed change =============== This proposal spans a migration change for handling the existing data in Glance DBs for all the existing deployed clouds. Alternatives ------------ Cloud operator admins can modify the exising databases to remove the sensitive information using a mysql command. However, changing production level data on such an important piece of information needs some level of sophistication. A migration like this would ensure data consistencies during upgrade and downgrade process of the databases as well avoiding manual mess. Data model impact ----------------- All existing rows containing sensitve info in the Image locations table would be modified. * Current scheme of the image location is like [3]. Proposal to change it to something like [4]. * This change would possibly involve a single migration for the change in schema as proposed above. * All the applicable rows would be parsed to look for the sensitive infomation. i.e. A check to see if the row fits scheme [3] or scheme [4]. If it fits the former, data would be parsed and stripped to adhere to scheme [4]. [3] swift+http(s)://user:password@auth_endpoint/v1.0/container/obj [4] swift+config://store/container/obj REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- This change reduces the risk of exposing sensitve information - username and password for Images container for Single and Multi Tenant Swift stores. * This change touches sensitive user data which contains remote location of their image. * Also, touches Images container password which is going to be scrubbed from the image location during migration. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- * This a change does not take effect until the migration of the Database is explicitly called. * This change would come with standard installation of glance and work with existing DB migration utility. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- If more than one person is working on the implementation, please designate the primary author and contact. Primary assignee: nikhil-komawar Other contributors: ben-roble Work Items ---------- * Draft a final strategy for migration. * Introduce the migration script in the Glance codebase including data consistency checks, unit tests, etc. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= None Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/98722 * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34801 * https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1100220 * swift+http(s)://user:password@auth_endpoint/v1.0/container/obj * swift+config://store/container/obj

commit_message:
Glance scrubber RBD extension

Extend glance scrubber to allow scrubbing Ceph rbd
volumes.

Change-Id: I2e3b35eb2c9a9368b9841b9c13e7cee5f307cdcd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/31/141331/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Glance Scrubber RBD Extension ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/scrubber-rbd-extension The glance rbd backend driver needs a way to perform scrubbing for rbd unprotected images that have been deleted from glance but not Ceph itself since were protected for use by another service e.g. cinder. Problem description =================== If you do the following (using glance rbd backend): * create image A in glance * create volume B in Cinder from image A - results in image A set to 'protected' * delete image A - rbd image will remain in Ceph but image is deleted from glance * we currently have no way to delete the underlying rbd image Proposed change =============== Implement a new scrubber api in the Glance RBD driver that can be called from the Glance scrubber. When an image is deleted from Glance, if it's underlying rbd image cannot be deleted from Ceph it will be 'tagged' in Ceph as deletable so that an asynchornous task e.g. the glance scrubber can come along and check for tagged rbd images and attempt to delete them if they are unprotected. Alternatives ------------ Currently no alternative other than manually going into your Ceph cluster and deleting rbd volumes that are no longer associated with Glance images. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- Describe any potential security impact on the system. Some of the items to consider include: * Does this change touch sensitive data such as tokens, keys, or user data? * Does this change alter the API in a way that may impact security, such as a new way to access sensitive information or a new way to login? * Does this change involve cryptography or hashing? * Does this change require the use of sudo or any elevated privileges? * Does this change involve using or parsing user-provided data? This could be directly at the API level or indirectly such as changes to a cache layer. * Can this change enable a resource exhaustion attack, such as allowing a single API interaction to consume significant server resources? Some examples of this include launching subprocesses for each connection, or entity expansion attacks in XML. For more detailed guidance, please see the OpenStack Security Guidelines as a reference (https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Security/Guidelines). These guidelines are a work in progress and are designed to help you identify security best practices. For further information, feel free to reach out to the OpenStack Security Group at openstack-security@lists.openstack.org. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ Some performance considerations: * If there are a large number of rbd images to be scrubbed, this could cause a performance degradation in Ceph as it cleans up. A simple solution to this would be to provide a configurable limit on how many images can be scrubbed in one scrubber run. Other deployer impact --------------------- This assumes that the glance scrubber will be deployed. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- hopem Reviewers --------- Core reviewer(s): lzydev Other reviewer(s): jdurgin Work Items ---------- Implement glance_store._drivers.rbd scrubber functionality: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/132863/ Implement glance.scrubber hook for rbd scrubber tbd Dependencies ============ Will need to coordinate code between glance and glance_store. Testing ======= TBD Documentation Impact ==================== Will need to add doc entry to explain how this should be used from the glance scrubber. References ========== https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1185851

commit_message:
Add the StorPool image driver proposal.

Change-Id: I019ce9eb2b8733b3e22e9c0378e2b05581bb506f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/60/137360/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================ Driver to store images on a StorPool cluster ============================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/storpool-image-store There are various Glance image backend drivers providing access to network-attached storage, such as GridFS, Sheepdog, RBD, etc. The purpose of this blueprint is to add a driver supporting the volumes defined in a StorPool cluster. Problem description =================== StorPool is distributed data storage software running on standard x86 servers. StorPool aggregates the performance and capacity of all drives into a shared pool of storage distributed among the servers. Within this storage pool the user creates thin-provisioned volumes that are exposed to the clients as block devices. StorPool consists of two parts wrapped in one package - a server and a client. The StorPool server allows a hypervisor to act as a storage node, while the StorPool client allows a hypervisor node to access the storage pool and act as a compute node. In OpenStack terms the StorPool solution allows each hypervisor node to be both a storage and a compute node simultaneously. As a Deployer, I want to be able to use StorPool as backend for my image store, so that the interaction between Glance images and Cinder volumes may be simple and straightforward: creating a Glance image from a Cinder volume is as easy as taking a StorPool snapshot of the underlying StorPool volume's data, and creating a Cinder volume from a Glance image only involves creating a StorPool volume from the StorPool snapshot that represents the Glance image. This will also facilitate the StorPool integration into Nova's DiskImage backend - once Glance images are stored as snapshots in a StorPool cluster, "copying" them to create a Nova VM image will again merely create a StorPool volume from the image's underlying snapshot. Proposed change =============== The proposed driver will make use of the StorPool API (based on JSON over HTTP) to implement operations on Glance images as operations on StorPool snapshots. It will interoperate with the Cinder StorPool driver proposed at https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/storpool-block-driver and it will also interoperate with a Nova DiskImage StorPool driver that we will submit a blueprint and a spec for shortly. Alternatives ------------ We are aware of the work to make Glance use Cinder directly as a backend - https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/glance-cinder-driver However, we are also aware of some concerns about the completeness of this implementation, e.g. the ones mentioned in http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-November/049819.html Even with a full implementation of a Cinder backend for Glance, there would still be some value in StorPool-specific routines so that some operations are streamlined by translating them directly into StorPool primitives, e.g. clone a snapshot into a volume, create a snapshot that is a copy of an existing one, etc. Data model impact ----------------- A ``storpool://`` scheme will be added to describe images stored in a StorPool cluster. REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ Certain image-related operations will need to be synchronized and possibly executed one at a time. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Peter Penchev <openstack-dev@storpool.com> Other contributors: None Reviewers --------- None. Work Items ---------- * Write the driver. * Write unit tests. * Provide certification tests. * Provide a CI setup. Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= Since the test setup requires an operational StorPool cluster, the unit tests will mostly use mocking to simulate the operations. A separate continuous integration environment will be set up by StorPool and access to it will be provided for running automated CI tests. Documentation Impact ==================== Using the StorPool driver will be documented. References ========== The StorPool distributed storage software: http://storpool.com/

commit_message:
Provide possibility to add nessus node to env

Adding possibility to create devops node from
predefined volume with installed and activated
nessus

Blueprint: security-scanning-nessus

Change-Id: Ice328e17502281c41279153a2420f246ffda028f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/85/209585/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: SECURITY_TEST = get_var_as_bool('SECURITY_TEST', False) NESSUS_IMAGE_PATH = os.environ.get('NESSUS_IMAGE', '/var/lib/libvirt/images/nessus.qcow2')

commit_message:
Adds support for x509 certificates as keypairs

Adds new parameter --key-type for novaclient for creating x509
certificates as keypairs. If no --key-type is specified, a ssh
keypair is created, for backwards compatibility.
Adds 'Type' column for keypair-list, displaying the keypair type.

This commit will have to merge after:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/140313

Depends-On: I215662f2f92a01921a866c3218031787a9eaf915

Implements: blueprint keypair-x509-certificates

Co-Authored-By: Andrey Kurilin <andr.kurilin@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alex Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>
Change-Id: I12bb13e24b660ffb6da0e5be275acbba7453d011
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/58/136458/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @utils.arg('--key-type', metavar='<key-type>', default='ssh', help='Keypair type. Can be ssh or x509.') @utils.arg('--key_type', help=argparse.SUPPRESS) key_type = args.key_type keypair = cs.keypairs.create(name, pub_key, key_type) columns = ['Name', 'Type', 'Fingerprint']

commit_message:
Set "latest" as default compute api version

It would be nice to use "latest" version of api by default.

Related to bp api-microversion-support

Change-Id: Ife981c87d32011f01fcbdf871071a9d8273ebb92
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/58/184658/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add version discover and check in CLI

This patch adds version discovery when user request with latest version.
The latest version means the most recently version between server and
client.

Related to bp api-microversion-support
Co-Authored-By: Alex Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>
Change-Id: I0b7a95e77371aef6e349bf54b5dd6ce6c6d2732c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/81/184281/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if (obj.api_version.is_latest() and hasattr(obj, "get_supported_versions")): versions = [v for v in obj.get_supported_versions() if v.id == "v2.1" and v.status == "CURRENT"] if not versions: # TODO(andreykurilin): raise correct exception raise Exception() min, max = versions[0].min_version, versions[0].version methods = [m for m in methods if m.start_version >= min and m.end_version <= max]

commit_message:
Add network groups support for v2

Examples:

To create a new network group:
    fuel2 network-group create --node-group 1 --release 2 --vlan 100
        --cidr 10.0.0.0/24 --meta '{"notation": "cidr"}' New_Network

To update network group:
    fuel2 network-group update --name New_Name --vlan 200
        --meta '{"notation": "cidr"}' 1

To delete specified network group:
    fuel2 network-group delete 1

To list all available network groups:
    fuel2 network-group list

To show specified network group:
    fuel2 network-group show 1

Partial-Bug: #1478577
Change-Id: I9eaa01af25b68c6d41b02c7d9d99ae42ce998515

commit_message:
Make sure prep_resize() calls for retry with flavor object

Retries are made with calls to conductor task api resize_instance()
that previously has been converted to objects. Since prep_resize()
still use a instance_type primitive, this only works as long as
the conductor method still has compat code that converts to a proper
flavor object.

Change-Id: I243a09391195d204acfac9bf2663e857a2a3b389
Closes-Bug: #1454846

commit_message:
[WIP] Enhance IPv6 scenario - dual network testing

Dual Network is where instead of 2 subnets with different IP versions on the
same network, we use 2 neutron-networks, each with its own subnet.
In the former, each server has a single vNIC with 2 IP addresses. In the
latter, each server has 2 vNICs.

This patch adds tests with dual network for the test_network_v6 scenarios.

Change-Id: I3d558a40460e81c8777652a55ee4b816ace0e84b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/53/208453/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def prepare_network(self, address6_mode, n_subnets6=1, dualstack=False): if dualstack - create IPv6 subnets on a differnt network :return: list of created networks if dualstack: self.network_v6 = self._create_network(tenant_id=self.tenant_id) net6 = self.network_v6 if dualstack else self.network sub6 = self._create_subnet(network=net6, return [self.network, self.network_v6] if dualstack else [self.network] def prepare_server(self, networks=None): networks = networks or [self.network] create_kwargs['networks'] = [{'uuid': n.id} for n in networks] # if len(networks) > 1: # ssh.renew_lease() def _prepare_and_test(self, address6_mode, n_subnets6=1, dualstack=False): net_list = self.prepare_network(address6_mode=address6_mode, n_subnets6=n_subnets6, dualstack=dualstack) sshv4_1, ips_from_api_1 = self.prepare_server(networks=net_list) sshv4_2, ips_from_api_2 = self.prepare_server(networks=net_list) @test.idempotent_id('b6399d76-4438-4658-bcf5-0d6c8584fde2') @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_dualstack_slaac_from_os(self): self._prepare_and_test(address6_mode='slaac', dualstack=True) @test.idempotent_id('76f26acd-9688-42b4-bc3e-cd134c4cb09e') @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_dualstack_dhcp6_stateless_from_os(self): self._prepare_and_test(address6_mode='dhcpv6-stateless', dualstack=True) @test.idempotent_id('cf1c4425-766b-45b8-be35-e2959728eb00') @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_dualstack_multi_prefix_dhcpv6_stateless(self): self._prepare_and_test(address6_mode='dhcpv6-stateless', n_subnets6=2, dualstack=True) @test.idempotent_id('9178ad42-10e4-47e9-8987-e02b170cc5cd') @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_dualstack_multi_prefix_slaac(self): self._prepare_and_test(address6_mode='slaac', n_subnets6=2, dualstack=True)
deleted_lines: def prepare_network(self, address6_mode, n_subnets6=1): sub6 = self._create_subnet(network=self.network, def prepare_server(self): create_kwargs['networks'] = [{'uuid': self.network.id}] def _prepare_and_test(self, address6_mode, n_subnets6=1): self.prepare_network(address6_mode=address6_mode, n_subnets6=n_subnets6) sshv4_1, ips_from_api_1 = self.prepare_server() sshv4_2, ips_from_api_2 = self.prepare_server()

commit_message:
rest: fix archive policy controller

Since version 0.9, pecan handles 405 error correctly.

This change split the ArchivePoliciesController in two parts.
One for /archive_policy and another for /archive_policy/<name>.

So pecan correctly understands what is the resource and the resource
root and raises the appropriate error for missing method.

Change-Id: Ia592f5bda7add2c48c7a3c4415dd02f2afeb8f14
Closes-bug: #1334690

commit_message:
add gerrit groups for monasca-log

Fujitsu works on Log Management solution for Monasca. Since our team
concentrates on that topic and also plans to contribute further monasca-log-*
projects, I think it is a good idea to create seperate gerrit groups and
include them in monasca-core and monasca-release respectively.

Change-Id: Iba49515e530ee3721f2b6dae1a9cdc872445925f

commit_message:
Modify atomic action timer in lb scenarios

Currently, the atomic action calculates time taken to create
every individual pool created during an iteration. Instead it
would be the best to have the time to create N pools created
in an iteration like "neutron.create_{N}_pools".

Change-Id: I772e741078e02eeb5c6944d7bb83b4d0237bdf1c

commit_message:
gnocchi: retry with a new token on 401

The gnocchi dispatcher just bail out on any unexpected Gnocchi HTTP code.

This change moves all Gnocchi API and HTTP stuffs in the gnocchi_client
module.
And improves the handling of 401 error code to retry requests when the
authentication fail, usualy because the token have expired.

Change-Id: I9d7e29337de2cb480c64af03032dcf9fa2a3829c

added_lines: import retryingclass AuthentificationError(Exception): pass def retry_if_authentification_error(exception): return isinstance(exception, AuthentificationError) def maybe_retry_if_authentification_error(): return retrying.retry(retry_on_exception=retry_if_authentification_error, wait_fixed=2000, stop_max_delay=60000) def check_if_authentification_error(self, response): if response.status_code == 401: with self._gnocchi_api_lock: self._gnocchi_api = None LOG.info("Authentification failure, retrying...") raise AuthentificationError() @maybe_retry_if_authentification_error() self.check_if_authentification_error(r) @maybe_retry_if_authentification_error() self.check_if_authentification_error(r) @maybe_retry_if_authentification_error() self.check_if_authentification_error(r) @maybe_retry_if_authentification_error() self.check_if_authentification_error(r)
deleted_lines: # TODO(sileht): Any HTTP 50X/401 error is just logged and this method # stop, perhaps we can be smarter and retry later in case of 50X and # directly in case of 401. A gnocchiclient would help a lot for the # latest.

commit_message:
Use storage scenario test base to test migration

This change make the migration test running based on real storage backend
scenario.

Change-Id: If4cb8960406545bfa4157be40879f1fbf301724c
Closes-Bug: 1481875

This CR is initial for sequence of functional tests implementation.
It contains only moving files and modules to right directories and
fixing tox.ini. This approach allows to avoid constantly rebase conflicts,
because git handles file removing correct.

Next step - separate classes and functions from moved files to right
test types.

Change-Id: I16b84ed83ac075658626f3ec6a35a24e228b61e7

commit_message:
Initial separating unit and functional tests

Currently we run tests which uses real backend or real daemons with
other unit tests.
This CR is initial for sequence of functional tests implementation.
It contains only moving files and modules to right directories and
fixing tox.ini. This approach allows to avoid constantly rebase conflicts,
because git handles file removing correct.

Next step - separate classes and functions from moved files to right
test types.

Depends-On: Ifdb0de150b2c738117308b2aae6c0c197e162821

Change-Id: I16b84ed83ac075658626f3ec6a35a24e228b61e7
Partialy-Implement: blueprint ceilometer-functional-tests
